channel.title: Compiler trouble
channel.description:
what's wrong with this compiler? Why does it say "system cannot find path specified" when I put the jdk path and everything.
Here's compiler code [code=java]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_31 in\javac.exe" -cp bin;lib/jython.jar;lib/junit-2.6.jar;lib/commons-compress-1.0.jar;lib/mina-core-2.0.0-M6.jar;lib/slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar;lib/slf4j-jdk14-1.5.8.jar;lib/xpp3-1,1.4c.jar;lib/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar -d bin src\org\hyperion\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\util\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\map\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\index\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\index\impl\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\obj\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\*.java src\org\hyperion ileserver\*.java src\org\hyperion\data\*.java src\org\hyperion\ls\*.java src\org\hyperion\util\*.java src\org\hyperion\util\login\*.java src\org\hyperions2\*.java src\org\hyperions2	ask\*.java src\org\hyperions2	ask\impl\*.java src\org\hyperions2\packet\*.java src\org\hyperions2\model\*.java src\org\hyperions2\modelegion\*.java src\org\hyperions2\model
pc\*.java src\org\hyperions2\model

et\*.java src\org\hyperions2
et\ondemand\*.java src\org\hyperions2\login\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\quest\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\quest\impl\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content	raveling\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\agility\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\agility\impl\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills arming\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\magic\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\magic\impl\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\magic\impl\lunar\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\magic\impl\ancient\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\magic\impl\modern\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\skills\construction\*.java src\org\hyperions2\content\minigames\*.java pause[/code]

item.title: Compiler trouble
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:2, topic:436699”]code = dos
not java

and be sure to change to x86 if you have 64 bit[/quote]
Thx it works now.

item.title: Compiler trouble
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

what’s wrong with this compiler? Why does it say “system cannot find path specified” when I put the jdk path and everything.

Here’s compiler code

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_31\bin\javac.exe" -cp bin;lib/jython.jar;lib/junit-2.6.jar;lib/commons-compress-1.0.jar;lib/mina-core-2.0.0-M6.jar;lib/slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar;lib/slf4j-jdk14-1.5.8.jar;lib/xpp3-1,1.4c.jar;lib/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar
